lines.content: AI Usage in the Diablo ChatBot
1. Use ChatGPT to add closing feature to GUI window
2. Use ChatGPT to generate CSS file for diablo
3. Use ChatGPT to edit MainWindow, DialogBox java and fxml files to integrate CSS into GUI
4. Use ChatGPT to improve Storage constructor
5. Use Gemini to improve Storage constructor for jar file use
6. Use ChatGPT to solve edge case for "mark" and "find" commands

![Screenshot of an example conversation in the Diablo Chatbot.](Ui.png)
Diablo is a feature rich chatbot which allows users to store and access scheduled tasks.
The `list` command lists all the current tasks in the task list.
Assuming you have these tasks in the task list,
If there are no tasks in the list yet, this is the expected output:
There are currently no items in the list!
The `find` command finds all tasks in the task list containing a specified keyword.
Assuming you have these tasks in the task list,
If there are no tasks in the list yet, or no tasks contain the keyword, this is the expected output:
The items you are looking for are not in the list!
The `mark` command marks the task specified by its position in the task list.
Assuming you have these tasks in the task list,
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
The `delete` command deletes the task specified by its position in the task list.
Assuming you have these tasks in the task list,
The `deadline` command adds a deadline task to the task list.
This will be the expected output:
Got it. I've added this task:
The `todo` command adds a todo task to the task list.
This will be the expected output:
Got it. I've added this task:
The `event` command adds an event task to the task list.
This will be the expected output:
Got it. I've added this task:
This simply exits the chatbot and closes the GUI window.
If you don't know what a command does, you can use the `help` command followed by the command to find out!
This will be the expected output:
list - lists all current tasks in the task list
If you happen to be new to the chatbot, use the `help` command by itself to show all commands and use cases.
* Represents a custom exception for the Diablo chatbot.
* Represents a deadline given by a description and due date, and can be marked as done.
* @return Capital letter "D" which represents a deadline.
* Gets the due date of the task.
* @return String representation of the due date in the format yyyy-MM-dd.
* Represents an Event Task, which has a description, start and end date, and can be marked as done.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* @return Capital letter "E" which represents an event.
* Gets the start date of the event.
* @return String representation of the start date in the format yyyy-MM-dd.
* Gets the end date of the event.
* @return String representation of the end date in the format yyyy-MM-dd.
* Represents a general task with a description. Can be marked as done.
* Gets the status icon of the task, "X" if done and " " if not done.
* @return String representing the status of the task.
* Gets the type of task in string format.
* Gets the description of the task.
* Represents a ToDo Task, which has a description and can be marked as done.
* @return Capital letter "T" which represents a todo task.
* Represents the main class for the Diablo chatbot.
* Makes sense of information typed in by the user, and outputs a string for Diablo to message back.
* @param input String input by the user.
assert parsedInput[0] != null: "Parsed input should have at least an identifier";
* Writes current task list into diablo.txt for storage.
String byeMessage = "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";
Task event = new Event(parsedInput[1], parsedInput[2], parsedInput[3]);
String unknownMessage = "I don't know what that means!!! Type 'help' to see a list of functions.";

"\t\t-> this finds all tasks with work in the description";

private String toDoHelp = "todo - adds a todo task to the task list\n " +
"\t\t-> this adds a todo task with the description (go home)";
private String eventHelp = "event - adds an event task to the task list\n" +
"\t\t-> this adds an event task with the description (party) from 2024-10-3 to 2024-10-5";
* Takes a string and parses it based on the input logic of Diablo, returning a string array with the required
* @return String array containing the parsed contents of the string.
return new String[] {"deadline", "-1", "Please indicate a deadline!"};
return new String[] {"deadline", "-1", "Please indicate what the deadline is for!"};
return new String[] {"deadline", "-1", "Please write the date in the format yyyy-mm-dd"};
return new String[] {"todo", "-1", "Please include something you want to do!"};
return new String[] {"event", "-1", "Please include both /from and /to dates!"};
return new String[] {"event", "-1", "Your /to date is missing!"};
return new String[]{"event", "-1", "Your /from date is missing!"};
return new String[] {"event", "-1", "Please indicate what the event is!"};
return new String[] {"event", "-1", "Please write the dates in the format yyyy-mm-dd"};
return new String[] {"event", description, from, to};

* Filters tasks based on their description and a given key, and returns an ArrayList of filtered tasks as strings.

* Prints an error message in the chatbot given by a DiabloException.
* @param e An exception containing a message to be delivered to the user.
* Prints an error message in the case that the input does not meet chatbot requirements.
System.out.println("\t" + "I don't know what that means!!!");
* Prints a message to the user telling them that a specific task was added to the task list.
* @param task String representation of a Task object.
System.out.println("\tGot it. I've added this task:\n\t\t" + task);
* Prints a message to the user telling them a specific task in the task list was marked complete.
* @param task String representation of a Task object.

* Prints a message to the user telling them a specific task was deleted from the task list.
* @param task String representation of a Task object.
System.out.println("\t Alright, I've removed this task:\n\t\t" + task);
* Tests methods of the Parser class.
* Tests whether a string deadline input without /by produces the right parsed output.
String[] output = parser.parse("deadline i wanna go home");
* Tests whether a string deadline input with the wrong date format produces the right parsed output.
String[] output = parser.parse("deadline i wanna go home /by 19 January 2024");
assertEquals("Please write the date in the format yyyy-mm-dd", output[2]);
* Tests whether a string deadline input with /by but no date produces the right parsed output.
String[] output = parser.parse("deadline i wanna go home /by ");
assertEquals("Please write the date in the format yyyy-mm-dd", output[2]);
